review_title: A wonderful place to work, but be prepared to work hard!
job_title: Patient Care Associate (PCA) in Albany, NY
pros: Albany was a wonderful taste of Nursing and I recommend any prospective Nurses work as a PCA first, whether here or another location. Albany Medical Center was a very energetic place to work, with a motivated team for care and excellent trainers.
cons: The only downside for me was the understaffed nights- it can be really tough/near impossible to get to all your patients but luckily the Nurses mostly didn't mind helping get vitals if I was alone on the floor.

review_title: they work you to death but pay well
job_title: Prefer Not To Say in Albany, NY
pros: pay motivating management great team autonomy room for growth
cons: these hours are brutal, no work life balance

review_title: Great schedule as a part-time employee
job_title: Patient Care Associate (PCA) in Albany, NY
pros: they will consider your availability to accommodate with your schedule
cons: hard to earn PTO and limited call out

pros: There are a lot of good things about AMC - a lot of good that happens. There are managers that go above and beyond. If you find yourself lucky enough to be in a department with good/great management you will prosper.
cons: Then there are amangers who don’t respond to emails. Unfortunately if you have a manager who tells you one thing in person but then does another or doesn’t support you, after stating they will, you will not be successful.

review_title: Great for learning. Not great to stay
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Albany, NY
pros: Excellent learning environment, great starter for a nee career in nursing. Supportive teams
cons: The pay and compensation are just terrible. The parking situation is also a joke.

pros: Indoor, year round work, same location.
cons: Largest management, and “safety” grouping, of middle management, I ever saw in any facilities department.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Albany, NY
pros: great place, good team, good benefits
cons: commute is tough to Albany

pros: A fully remote coding position.
cons: Fully remote employment can lead to a sedentary lifestyle.

pros: Stability, learning and experience are great reason t work for Albany Medical Center
cons: Pay is embarrassing, do not come to this job with no experience or you will get low balled and have to fight for pay. Theres no bonus , theres 401 B not 401K admins don't have a union like nurses. Benefits really are not all that great if you don't choose to go to Albany Med Hospital or affiliates as a patient . Employees are pretty much over worked in all angels of the job, understaffed and under paid .

review_title: experience highly dependent on who your PI is

cons: If you do good work, you get taken advantage of and used. Does not take care of employees unless they have letters after their names. HR cannot be trusted, nor can your managers. Just do you work, mind your business, and get your paycheck.

review_title: Working Remotely soon to be full time onsite
job_title: Network Engineer III in Ballston Lake, NY
pros: Working Remotely allowed me to spend time with my newborn, leave my house, not get assigned big projects, clean my house and watch TV. It was great while it lasted. Spending time with my wife is Great. No surprise drug test are Great since Cannabis is legal now. Getting promoted was easy. AMC's respect for NYS Family Leave.
cons: When your at work your expected to work harder not smarter. Micro-management is intense and we don't know the direction of the Affiliation of grouping up with these 3 poorly performing Hospitals. We have too many exec's in IT. Family Leave should be available for the lifetime of your children. You have to travel to other Affiliates and help them out due to no staff.

pros: Great place to expand skills.
cons: There is a lot of staff turn over

pros: Diverse team, camaraderie among the nurses, lots of opportunity to learn and move around.
cons: Large hospital is business and more interested in revenue than it's employees

review_title: Fantastic opportunity at a company that compensates their staff well

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Latham, NY
pros: If you are in the pre-medical tract, becoming a PCA is one of the more beneficial experiences to add to your resume. Albany Med provides that experience, and the nurse managers in the float pool are very accommodating. Direct patient contact and life in the hospital prepare you for things to come if you choose to continue down the medical route.
cons: If you are a part of the float pool unit, some nurses/PCAs are not friendly and will treat you like you don't belong at times.

pros: Team players all around on my unit
cons: The pay is a slap in the face.

pros: Good dental insurance is here
cons: Albany Medical Center salary is

pros: I was a float pool nurse and absolutely loved working for AMC. My manager was amazing and would come to the floors that I worked every day and made sure my assignment was okay and just made sure I was doing okay overall. I grew a rapport with the other staff and providers on every floor and all floors were mostly welcoming. I only left due to the Union that came and caused a lot of hostility. If you weren’t for them, then you were against them and they made sure you knew you were an enemy. But I truly learned a lot there and will always be forever grateful for my time at AMC. As float pool, I got off whenever I needed and never had vacation time denied. And the cafeteria food was BOMB!!! That Wednesday turkey sandwich, I’m drooling just thinking about it.
cons:
1. The Union that brought a lot of anger and division, false accusations and harassment. 
2. The salary was not the greatest

pros: Flexible schedule, pay differentials, always overtime available
cons: A lot of abuse from patients, attitude from nurses, overpopulated hospital

review_title: It's not the worst, but it's not the best?
pros: I would say that it is a pretty easy enough job. Benefits are good, and for the most part the atmosphere is relatively friendly. You always have bad apples when it comes to employees but mangement does the best they possibly can.
cons: A lot of concerns with the way patients treat staff get swept under the rug. If you're a POC a lot of microagressions or racist comments from patients get chalked up to "having a bad day". There also isn't a lot of room for upward movement.

review_title: Would still be there if husband hadn't transferred out of state
pros: new CEO is excellent and embraces honest and open communication. CEO and CFO took voluntary paycuts and kept everyone employed during covid. NO layoffs! in general workplace environment is good. wide range of opportunities in an academic center
cons: Salary gaps are wide and don't always make sense. Can often be a big fish in a medium sized pond- too much of "old boys club" still exists here. even within nursing. Not uncommon to see staff that never worked anywhere else but AMC. the dedication is admirable but it also creates a lack of diversity and experiences and isn't always welcoming to others. you'll be viewed as an outsider for a long time. you'll hear "we've always done it this way" pretty frequently

review_title: Ridiculous HR places very low value on employees
pros: Seems like an OK workplace
cons: I relocate from another city to start working here. At no point am I told anything about when I have to get a medical screening in order to start working by a certain date. Now, having moved to another city and with bills to pay, by the narrowest of technicalities, I have to wait to start work for two weeks. HR here is a nightmare that places no value on employees.

representation of women in leadership roles and board(70% of employee)

pros: flexible hours, ability to move around within the company

review_title: IT there seemed like a good idea at the time.
job_title: Desktop Support Specialist in Albany, NY
pros: The combination of a high paced environment, large territory assignment, tickets, and special projects really forces you to become as efficient as possible. The Desktop staff is a good group of people to interact with and work along side of.
cons: There are more assigned deadlines than there is time to complete them. When everything is "high priority" it's hard to prioritize until you're told specifically to focus on one thing and let everything else slide. A few days later you're asked for updates on the things you were told to let slide, and questioned when you haven't made any progress. Other departments (namely Client/Server) don't work well with others, and aren't expected or forced to cooperatively share information or offer assistance. Issues seem to be thrown to desktop before the department who should have been handling the problem looks at it enough to realize it really WAS theirs all along.

pros: Level 1 trauma center experience
cons: Low wages comparable to hospitals in larger cities

pros: Transparency. Honesty. Loyalty. I love my job
cons: Understaffed and needs to update equipment

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in New York, NY

cons: Understaffing. Better pay for nurses

pros: Great benefits, tuition reimbursement, paid time off and holiday pay.

Lack diversity and inclusion
More growth opportunities for qualified staff

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Albany, NY

cons: Very busy hospital to many ppl for a Therapist to thrive

job_title: Patient Care Associate in Albany, NY
pros: Great group of colleagues. Plenty of vacation time. Rewarding work
cons: There were very slow weekends

pros: Cafeteria sometimes has good specials
cons: Cruel, thankless. Underpaid and overworked. Mismanaged and inefficient.

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Albany, NY
pros:
•Job security
•AMC offers general benefits
•Being a large level 3 Trauma Center, interesting specimens are often processed leading to an expansive understanding of rare diseases
cons:
•The benefits are poor and very expensive
•The CEO fails to provide appropriate wages for the workload put upon the labs
•The company has unionized nurses and were given a significant raise upon signing, whereas, all other departments received no benefits
•The company strives to “promote a healthy work environment” but will NOT recognize mental health as a necessity (I was told that AMC will not approve time off if found to be for mental health)
•The company fails to commit to the promises it makes (i.e. the lab was promised a cost of living adjustment as the hospital down the street did $3; however, when the new year hit, the company decided against doing as such)
•Supervisors and Management within Lab Administration have zero idea what the employees are paid and have been heard discussing with students that the starting salary is $70k, roughly $25k above the base starting rate

job_title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist in Albany, NY
pros: Great team environment, high level of care
cons: The retirement plan is not the best.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Albany, NY
pros: Level 1 trauma center allows for great experience. It is a teaching hospital.
cons: Vacation time and sick days are grouped under the same time off bank, PTO is capped off based on start date.

pros: its an essential job to preform
cons: they provide you with low pay

pros: culture are good for everyone out there
cons: low pay low pay low pay low

pros:
-The amount of different conditions, illnesses etc. you see working there will help you immensely during your career. 

-Some friendly co-workers
cons:
-Bullying and cliques among workers in this establishment are out of control. Management needs to take notice and control it. 

-Favoritism amongst some employees and management is beyond obvious. Politics are the only way you're going to advance your career if you do at all. 

-It's all about money in the eyes of administration except when it comes to giving deserving employees raises and other incentives. 

-While on morning shifts, get there at least 30-35 minutes early because shuttle and transportation is severely lacking. 

-Call in/sick time policy needs to be reviewed and changed. 

-Management could care less about their department's employees. When concerns or problems arise they don't listen or follow up on them. They listen to one side of the story and that's it.  They do not stick up for employees when  it is needed. 

-

pros: If you work in Information Technology prepare to learn and then leave.  Attitude toward IT is that you are replaceable.  There are chances you could move between departments.   Turnover is high so you won't have to worry about dealing with co-workers who have been there too long and the company now has the reputation that turnover is high so it won't reflect badly on your resume when you leave after only a year or less.   If you stay longer, you will be considered an expert and will have leeway within your title and will be a senior team member.
cons: No worries about your job performance because management doesn't follow through and has no plan in place for employees who want a real career.  No respect for individual work styles and no assistance for struggling employees. If you don't work out, you can leave and they don't care. For some, even if you can't do the work, as long as you have others within your department that will cover for you, and you present well, then you are safe.

pros: Lower Management is very good
cons: Higher management does not care about its staff

review_title: Research poor and going downhill fast - hospital side seems okay
pros: The hospital is continually expanding, and is acquiring neighborhood buildings. Trauma center is supposedly very good, so hospital employees may have access to cutting-edge technology. Once you get into your job, seems difficult to get fired, so high job security.
cons: Completely mismanaged by a group of good-ol'-boys that don't care much about research (even though they pretend to). Not so sure about the hospital side, but I hear a lot of complaints from friends that the management is only concerned with money over there, too. The management doesn't listen, because they don't need to - since they don't care about their employees, why should they change? Upper management is filled with men who only got the position because they agree with their superiors, so voicing concerns only brings headaches, never change about important matters.

review_title: Discrimination and favoritism run rampant at Albany Med.
pros: A great place to learn if your in the right department and you have a great mentor or manager. There are many good hardworking dedicated folks there who are often overlooked for advancement.
cons: Discrimination, nepotism, favoritism and sexism are the norm. Senior management are a bunch of old white quasi octogenarians. They have three white women  and one black make at the leadership level out of 15-20 positions. Blacks and latinos are forced out. They are also singled out for discipline at a disproportionate rate. The HR department tries hard but is understaffed and led by a race aversive bully. Moral is low. So too will be you pay unless you leave and come back. They hire felons and care providers with criminal records or post rehab but push out minorities every chance they get. I've put my notice in without having another job because the place is that toxic.

pros:
-Good for learning
-Night shift workers are all very supportive of each other
-Place to learn the basics of the medical field as well as gain resume experience
cons:
-The hospital continues to nickel and dime its employees. For five years there was a freeze on salary increases. The hospital continued to have a $40 million profit (not deficit, they were in the black $40 million in 2014 per a letter from the CEO)
-Benefits are sub-par, with employees having to hit a $250 deductible on health insurance, even when they are treated at Albany Medical Center facilities
-HR gives everyone a grade, once you are locked into a job grade, someone else can be hired a year later and make more money than you do
-Compared to salary studies, Albany Medical woefully underpays their staff.
-Combined Leave Time continues to shrink, once upon a time it used to be 12 hours earned per pay period, now it is (estimate) 5.3 hours per pay period.

review_title: It Will Be Hard To Forget
job_title: Administrative Support Associate in Albany, NY
pros: If you live in Albany, NY and can take public transportation this may be a good place for you.
cons: Pay for daily parking then you have to take a shuttle to get to/from your car.  Think about that, since it's usually cold and/or raining in Albany, NY.  The benefits are very expensive and, you have to go to their facilities or it's out of network which impacts who can be your primary care physician.  I didn't care for that.  But, what was the worst was the depth of low wage earners and how the stress of their daily living impacted what I observed.  Until working there, I have had experience with colleagues that were paid according to salary range labor rates and yearly cost of living increases.  While working for Albany Med, I'd have to listen to coworkers worrying about their daily life problems and, the stresses of working at Albany Med like having their car towed by Albany Police (those that couldn't afford to pay for parking), asking me for money because they were hungry, etc.

pros: Access to some of the best research and acute care in the region.  Continuing education availability is also a bonus.
cons: There is a good deal of political bickering and administrative incompetence.

review_title: Albany Med is a good place to work
pros: The organization has a mission you can believe in.  You feel like you're making a contribution to the community.  There are a lot of intelligent and dedicated people working at AMC, and there is a strong sense of teamwork.  I've always gotten a sense that they appreciate the efforts you make at your job and they have always been very supportive regarding personal/family issues.
cons: Sometimes they get rigid about dress codes.  They try to be cautious with money to the point that sometimes they seem penny wise and pound foolish.  The parking situation leaves a lot to be desired and you have to be careful in the neighborhood at night.

review_title: Not a lot of money for a lot of work.
pros: Pros - it's a job.  Depending on which building you work there are some nice people.  The cafeteria is decent.
cons: Cons - the bathrooms are disgusting.  Depending on which building parking is horrible and if you get in the garage or lot you have to pay.  Have only had one raise in the years I have been here.  Very bad sick time off policy.  Management just does not care about their employees.

pros: Albany Medical Center is a wonderful place to gain experience and learn. It is a large, academic hospital with a diverse environment. As a Respiratory Therapist, you can develop a strong foundation for your future.
cons: While AMC is a great place to learn, it comes with its challenges. Working as a Respiratory Therapist can be difficult mainly due to poor management. The department itself has amazing potential, but it is inhibited by poor management that lacks the ability to embrace their employees. Pay is also very low. Begining RT salary is only around $21 per hour.

pros: This is a great place to learn and grow.  I started here 14 years ago thinking it was a temporary job while I was in college.  Albany Med paid for my Nursing School at Hudson Valley Community College, and supported my advanced degrees at Excelsior.  I have been a nurses' aide, a technician, a bedside nurse, and now I am an educator.
cons: The world of healthcare in general is constantly changing, and Albany Med gets the sickest of the sick patients.  Many of our patients are on government health programs like Medicaid and Medicare, so our profit margin is lower than other hospitals.

review_title: Center for Donation and Transplant under Albany Medical College
pros: The mission of this organization is amazing and you get to make a difference in the lives of many people. Flexible work environment and very meaningful work. Lots of great opportunities to be involved in clinical settings. Coworkers were dedicated and passionate.
cons: Salary and benefits were not competitive for education and experience. Some employees treated unfairly in regards to salary. Somewhat restricted work environment due to being controlled by Albany Medical College. Management was somewhat combative with each other and they didn't always appreciate the hard work of their employees. No growth potential as this is a very small organization. You would have to transfer to another state organ & tissue bank for a potential promotion.

review_title: Take notice of what is happening with your nursing staff.
pros: Large level 1 trauma center. Good experience. It gives you the experience of a large hospital. There are a lot of nice people there.
cons: Staff is not appreciated. Benefits are not great. You will not have health insurance when you retire. They do not mach your retirement savings. Raises are given yearly with your evaluation, up to 5%. Unfortunately the managers are advised to only give a top raise of 3%. Anything above that must be approved by administration.

pros: Albany Med is stable and is growing organically. Leadership is strong and employees are happy for the most part. Employees are loyal...evident by the impressive number of staff devoting their careers to AMC.
cons: Pay is OK, time off is lacking. Employee parking is a growing issue as it can't keep pace with the significant expansion across the board (more buildings, more patients, more staff). If you are lucky, have been there a while, or are connected to get a garage spot (or even a lot spot for that matter) you will have to pay for parking each pay period.

review_title: 32 years on staff BSN-PICU, ED, Transfer Center
pros: Wide variety of available services for whatever your specialty is in, opportunities to advance your degree, large hospital with both clinical and non-clinical areas to work.
cons: In midst of possible unionizing and it is not a smooth process. At times the increase in deductibles and calling if salaries is quite unfair when higher positions are getting fewer charges like parking and raises in salaries.

review_title: It has the potential to be a great place to work
pros: If you focus on the fact that no matter what department you're in you are in your own way helping sick people get better then you can find working here rewarding.  However management will go out of it's way to destroy that sentiment in you every chance they get.
cons: The entire organization is too top heavy.  Every day I feel like I'm in a new secret reality show version of Office Space.  Those of us on the ground trying to get work done are constantly mired in the pathetic "high school girl" type bickering between managers, directors, VPs, and other sr. management.

pros: The people at AMC in day-to-day operations are fantastic.  The scientists and staff are friendly, intelligent, and caring.
cons: Little institutional support as a whole.  The hospital is more concerned with the hospital than things that deal with anything research-related.  Compensation is grossly disproportionately weighed towards the hospital, including benefits and such.  Not really liking the fact that AMC as a policy calls patients "customers."

pros: Fascinating job if you have an interest in healthcare.  Decent benefits and meaningful work.
cons: Can be hectic and overwhelming at times.  Salary increases of poor, mediocre, and top performing ASAs are nearly identical and barely meet inflation.  This I hear extends to other positions and I was surprised to hear that a RN with a BA as opposed to a 2 year degree only makes 25 cents more an hour.  It's hard to get fired, which is a pro if you're a slacker, but a con for those who pick up the slack.

review_title: Best Hospital in the Capital Region
job_title: Clinical Laboratory Technologist in Albany, NY
pros: I've experienced several institutions in the Albany, NY region and Albany Medical Center stood out as the best place to work, taking all things into consideration. You get the sense that this company takes better care of its employees than its competitors. Financially they are doing well in a struggling healthcare market. Job security is good here.
cons: Some may get lost in this big environment, so this may not be the ideal place to work for the small-town person. Salaries could be better.

pros: Good relations, great with education, just ok benefits, not so great pay, but can move up and receive raises pretty quickly. Decent patient ratios. I learned a lot my first year as a nurse here and was grateful for the opportunity
cons: Not great pay, sometimes management can be problematic and more harm than good to some. More issues lie within management than the hospital itself.

pros:
There's always going to be a couple bad apples to ruin things for you employee wise but there's definitely more good people that are willing to help and teach. But I may just be in a good department.
The Gym and Cafeteria is great as well
cons: Extremely hard to get hired here unless you know someone. Even if you manage to get hired but wish to switch departments its still very hard to move around.

job_title: Administrative Support Associate V in Albany, NY
pros:
- Decent health insurance for a single person, way too high for families
- Hours are good- varying depending on your shift
- Good training and support provided
cons:
- HORRIBLE PAY- I had to work a second job to support myself
- The higher ups and senior management make a disgusting amount more than their support staff and seem out of touch with lower staff

pros: Great for anyone thinking of a nursing career. Real life experience. You will shadow for a few hours prior to accepting a job offer to be sure you like it. Training is comprehensive and you won't start your first day feeling "over your head".
cons:
The parking is especially horrendous during the 7am-7pm shift. Make sure you get there early as there is a good chance you'll drive from lot to lot looking for parking. 
Starting wage was low but I was given a raise within a few weeks.

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Albany, NY
pros: New buildings, thoughtful management, and all around great place to work. The hospital knows the business well and has been quick to exercise strength for marketshare. Senior management is helpful and when you need answers, many are willing to help. There's a sense of pride in patient care which makes Albany Med unique in the area.
cons: Limited training on IT systems can be frustrating. Upward movement in the organization can be challenging and may take a lot of time, especially in a support role (finance, marketing, human resources).

job_title: Patient Care Associate in Albany, NY
pros: Good exposure to the medical field. Overall, good camaraderie amongst the nursing staff. Have the ability to learn different terminology and the general flow of a teaching hospital.
cons: Nurse managers have very little regard for fellow employees. They treat you as if you are just another number in their book. Not very understanding of people's situations.

review_title: A horrible place to work, esp as your first full time job out of college. Gives a bad outlook on the real world.
pros: Not very many, the benefits.
cons: Management pays no attention to their employees. Anyone who is good at their job becomes responsible for picking up the slack of other employees and management lets them get away with it. There is no supervision and the good employees are taken advantage of. The turnover rate in the specific dept I'm employed in is extremely high.

review_title: Awesome Place to Learn, Advance your Career, and Get Paid
pros:
The best thing is that I was hired without any prior research experience, just a BSc.  So it is the perfect place to get your foot in the door.  

Great learning environment, ability to make my own schedule and to gain independence and publications in research projects as a technician, great seminars and lectures by scientists from around the country.
cons:
Your job is at the mercy of grant funding.
No bonuses.  Took a very long time to get a raise.

review_title: A great place that needs fine tuning
pros: A great place to learn new skills and be at the cutting edge of medicine.
cons: There are many fitness/well being programs for employees.  However, they are limited in size and  timing issues prevent greater interest/participation.  Lack of support staff to do the routine paperwork to free up clinicians to do patient care.

pros:
Since it is a teaching hospital, there is much to learn and many to learn from. You will see a great variety of procedures, conditions,  that may not be seen at other facilities. 

In place protocols provide a good guide for patient care and allow the nurse a fair amount of autonomy.
cons:
Antiquated information systems that are not integrated.
not alot of feedback or recognition for a job well done

pros: Some of the pros of AMC is its rich history.  As a nurse you are able to see everything that can happen and the education is valuable.
cons: The cons of AMC is no real opportunity for growth and the pay is low.  There is some favoritism that goes on there depending on the unit you work on.

review_title: Great Stepping Stone to Law Enforcement
pros: It's a great place to work if you like a fast paced environment and hands on learning. Definitely the best job for building experience if you're interested in a career in law enforcement.
cons: In the beginning your days off, although always two in a row, will not be weekends. Example: I currently have Mondays and Tuesdays off. As of now, the schedule does not rotate.

pros: The availability for overtime is amazing. Administration will work with you on taking time off and is very sensitive to keeping you happy. Best job I have had in the 14 years I have been working. Certainly isn't perfect though.
cons: Too much time is spent on reaction rather than being proactive. So much potential to be had but not being properly utilized. This place is truly a city within a city. Should be treated as such and it isn't.

review_title: My overall experience working at AMCH was very satisfing, as well as rewarding.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Albany, NY
pros: The learning experiences, are uncomparable to any other I've had, and have been a large asset to further9ing my nursing career.
cons: It's a very fast paced and demanding physically as well as mentally.

pros: There are a lot of great people who work there and everyone has a positive attitude. The place is huge and there really is a lot of experience to gain with so many different systems.
cons: For being a hospital, the health benefits are not that great. The workload was massive for my position and the hours were less than desirable for someone with a family.

job_title: Administrative Support Associate in Albany, NY
pros: Albany Medical Center is a great place to work because there is so many different area'a you can choose from, it is very diverse, competitive salaries and an organization of excellence. My experience at Albany Medical Center has been a ewardi g experience.
cons: Albany Medical Center is a huge teaching hospital so parking can be very challenging.

review_title: Great purpose and mission driven organization
pros: Great people to work with who all understand the mission of excellence in patient care, education and research.    The patient is always the most important
cons: High volume and high stresses environment.   It can struggle under the weight of its own size and complicated simple things more than it needs to some times.

job_title: Enrollment Specialist in West Sand Lake, NY
pros: Decent benefits although over the they have declined. Raises are few and far between out of the 7 years I was employed with Albany Med they suspended raises for all staff.
cons: Very political. Unless you hold a supervisor position in the organization you will never get promoted, even if you are a higher pay grade than the supervisor you will be told that you have to go backwards to move forward.

review_title: Large academic medical center in Albany, NY. Many specialties, level 1 trauma center.
pros: Close knit "family" feel on unit. Very good orientation experience as a new graduate nurse. Nurse residency program for new nurses. A lot of classes available to become certified in.
cons: Staffing issues prevalent, either completely over staffed and half of the unit gets floated, or were completely understaffed and slammed. Never a happy medium. Double standards with management playing favorites.

job_title: Patient Care Associate in Lebanon, MO
pros: The Best benefits you can probably find in the area short of being a state worker.  You also get the benefit of saying that you work at the Med.
cons: LOTS OF DRAMA!!!  If you cant handle high school behavior than this is NOT the place for you.  It all depends on the unit and the staff that fill it. Some are better than others

job_title: Administrative Support Associate in Albany, NY
pros: Good environment, decent room for growth for non-clinical staff. Really good benefits, after 5 years I had 5 weeks vacation a year.
cons: No matching 403b, short breaks, stressful work, working with doctors can become a chore. Non-flexible hours, poor management.

pros: Dynamic healthcare environment.  Can be great resume builder.   Significant financial investment made in technology systems.   Work can be rewarding since it impacts patients.  Talented physicians.
cons: While some team members are great to work with, some are extremely mean or passive aggressive and create a hostile work environment.   Certain favored people are protected (client server mgr) and serious complaints are not addressed.  The good managers are not empowered to make needed changes. Some people are allowed to make a career out of blaming others. Low salaries for most people yet senior executives are well compensated. Benefits are expensive and not great. "Pay for performance" only gives an addition 1 percent raise to top performers and in certain departments you have to be exceptional to get it. There's no real incentive to work harder.  Albany Med is always claiming to be poor but money is wasted all over the place. No real work from home opportunities like at other companies (they have something but jt is a joke).  Lots of red tape. People are leaving the IT department left and right creating huge holes in knowledge and more work for everyone.  On call time required for most is not compensated for most employees.  Horrible HR department.  Parking situation is a disaster.  Not only do you have to pay for parking but local parking isn't available for new employees.  Albany recommends coming to work early on your own time to find parking.

pros: The majority of people who work there are competent and nice.
cons: The administration suffers from utter incompetence and small-mindedness. They care very little about what's true. Lying is acceptable. They do not value education or research, even though they may pretend to do so. It's all part of a facade. The only thing that really matters to them is how much money is brought into the institution.

pros: Great place to work. Busy place but valued as an employee. Many different shifts available to work and many opportunities to advance.
cons: Management is not always looking out for the people who work so hard for the hospital.  They don't often use common sense regarding scheduling.

pros: Some excellent coworkers.  People care about the job they do and clients they serve.  Undergoing a growth cycle so there are opportunties for career advancement.
cons: Staff churn.  Higher than expected turnover.  Salaries are less than similar academic med centers in other states and areas.

review_title: AMC is a great place to learn, although the pay could be better and the work is sometimes overbearing.
pros: Great learning environment, wonderful staff that works well together, there's a 403b plan, there are benefits such as free bus transportation on the CDTA
cons: The pay is not as competitive as other areas, there is a high turnover rate, the staffing is frequently short so the workload fluctuates

review_title: This is a great place to work
pros: Good job environment and good compensation. This is a great place to do research and learn from your colleagues. I could have access to patients which facilitated my research
cons: Albany, NY is a small city and it doesn't offer too many thing to do. It is a cold city, although people in that place are great.

pros: Great team, good people. Kind to patients and are passionate about their jobs.
cons: Poor management. No advancement opportunities. Promotions are based on favoritism, not merit, experience, or education. Lowest salary in the area. Not much of cost of living raise. Leadership team needs to reassessed.

review_title: Great place to learn and grow as an RN.
pros:
Awesome learning experience--teaching hospital. 
Starbucks and 24 hour Dunkin Donuts!
Benefits.
cons: Paid less than at community hospitals. Manager sets the tone. Several units have issues with this.

job_title: Administrative Assistant/Health Unit Coordinator in Albany, NY
pros: Great benefits, provides benefits for Health and dental. Has a good benefit for time off. Best part is Albany Medical Center helps pay for school tuition through Tuition Reimbursement. They also help employees further study and become nurses or in other health professional field.
cons: Nothing to really make as a con. Management is good and no real issues

job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Albany, NY
pros: Health insurance is not terrible
cons: Despite stating they are all about patient care, they are not.  They are solely about making money for the top level executives.  Micromanagement is insane.  Pay is below national average and not enough to live on.

job_title: Senior Applications Specialist in Latham, NY
pros: stable place to work because AMC is always growing and you don't have to worry about being laid-off
cons: on call, on street parking for IT unless you park in the commuter lots, no real work from home policy, no real sick time, minimal raises

review_title: What I think of my job.
job_title: Health Unit Coordinator (HUC) in Albany, NY
pros:
Supportive staff
Honest integrity and communication
Helpful and meaningful resources
